name: Mani Pulite
overview: This game is inspired by the scandalous events of the homonymous judicial inquiry of the 1990s, which poses the so-called first Italian Republic. It is a platform game with simple elements of combat, in which we will have to drive a caricature of the then secretary of the Leghistary party Umberto Bossi through more levels with the aim of defeating some senators of the first Republic (also appropriately chargeable). Designed and carried out by the team of Padovani DoubleByte programmers in 1993, the title could be purchased directly from them (by telephone order) or found in a few selected stores The game, as regards the Amiga version has been programmed in Amos language, was released exclusively on Amiga and PC-DOS platforms.
